member.name: T:CB.Data.ClearBase32
member.summary:
Transcodes to a clearer version of the Base32 encoding.
The character set does not contain characters that could be confounded. Such as 'I' and '1', 'l' and '1', 'O' and '0'.

member.name: F:CB.Data.ClearBase32.CharacterSet
member.summary: The 32 characters set.

member.name: F:CB.Data.ClearBase32.CharacterOrder
member.summary:
The character order set.
For example, CharacterOrder['A'] = 0, CharacterOrder['B'] = 1, CharacterOrder['b'] = 1
Lower-case characters are included in the set.
Invalid characters return -1.

member.name: M:CB.Data.ClearBase32.Encode(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encodes a byte array to a base32 string.

member.name: M:CB.Data.ClearBase32.Decode(System.String)
member.summary:
Decodes a base32 string to a byte array, retreiving the original data.
If the source has an invalid format, returns null.
The source can contain lower and upper-case letters.
member.returns: The decoded byte array, or null if the source format is invalid.

member.name: M:CB.Data.ClearBase32.EncodeText(System.String)
member.summary: Encodes the source as UTF-8 then encodes it as a ClearBase32.
member.exception: An error occured during the UTF-8 encoding.

member.name: M:CB.Data.ClearBase32.DecodeAsText(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes the source, then encodes the result as a UTF-8 String.
member.exception: The source format is invalid, or the decoded data is not a valid UTF-8 string.
The decoded data is not a valid UTF-8 string.

member.name: M:CB.Data.ClearBase32.EncodeToAByteArray(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encodes a byte array to a base32 string that is in turn coded as its UTF8 binary representation.

member.name: M:CB.Data.ClearBase32.DecodeFromByteArray(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Decodes a base32 string that was coded as its UTF8 binary representation.
member.param: An UTF8 binary representation of the base32 string.

member.name: M:CB.Data.ClearBase32.EncodeTextToAByteArray(System.String)
member.summary: Encodes a regular string to a base32 string that is in turn coded as its UTF8 binary representation.

member.name: M:CB.Data.ClearBase32.DecodeAsStringFromByteArray(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Decodes a base32 string that was coded as its UTF8 binary representation.

member.name: F:CB.Files.FileEx.PathComparer
member.summary:
A portable comparer for file-system paths.
On Linux and macOS, the comparer takes letter case into account. On Windows, it ignores letter case.
Starting and ending spaces, and quotation marks are removed before comparison.
Relative paths are not resolved.
Path syntax and existence are not checked.

member.name: F:CB.Files.FileEx.FileNameComparer
member.summary:
A portable comparer for pure file names. Paths are ignored.
On Linux and macOS, the comparer takes letter case into account. On Windows, it ignores letter case.
Starting and ending spaces, and quotation marks are removed before comparison.
Relative paths are not resolved.
Path syntax and existence are not checked.

member.summary:
Starts the process as elevated, that is as an administrator.
On Windows XP and previous, the started process must check it is really elevated (because it can be started as any user).
member.exception: User has canceled the UAC prompt. Or an error occurred when opening the associated file. -or-The sum of the length of the arguments and the length of the full path to the process exceeds 2080. The error message associated with this exception can be one of the following: "The data area passed to a system call is too small." or "Access is denied."

No file name was specified in the startInfo parameter's System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.FileName property.-or- The System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.UseShellExecute property of the startInfo parameter is true and the System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.RedirectStandardInput, System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.RedirectStandardOutput, or System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.RedirectStandardError property is also true.-or-The System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.UseShellExecute property of the startInfo parameter is true and the System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.UserName property is not null or empty or the System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.Password property is not null.
The parameter is null.
The process object has already been disposed.
The file specified in the startInfo parameter's System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.FileName property could not be found.

member.summary:
Retuns 0 if the strings are equal, or if both have no value. Otherwize, compare positions in the sort order (see for more information). Retuns -1 if this string is less than the , or if this string has no value while the has a value. Retuns 1 if this string is more than the , or if this string has a value while the has no value.
Warning: this comparison is not cached (unlike the equality comparison).
